characters: REPENT. THE END IS EXTREMELY FUCKING NIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...surgical chamber. And watching the screens is a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...chimp, strapped to an operating table, with its skull dissected open, webbed in wires and monitoring devices, muzzled with a transparent guard. Alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the surgical chamber, through the wide doorframe, can see a larger laboratory beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of black-clad ALF Activists, all wearing balaclav move down a corridor. They carry various gear - bag, bolt cutters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move, one Activist reaches up to a security camer and sprays it black with an aerosol paint can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Activists enter the laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief Activist takes his camera off his shoulder and starts taking photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is huge and long, and darkened except for specif pools of light. Partially illuminated are rows of cages w clear perspex doors. They run down either side of the roo In the cages are chimpanzees. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most are in a state of rabid agitation, banging and clawi against the perspex, baring teeth through foam-flecked mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the far end of the lab, where on a huge steel operating table they see the dissected chimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dissected chimp's eyes flick to the Activists. Blood wells from around the exposed brain tissue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears starts to roll down the Female Activist's cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Female Activist) Keep your shit together. If we're going to get them out of here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Finnish Activist is checking the perspex cages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can pop these, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Finnish Activist raises his crowbar and sticks it aro the edge of one of the doors - about to prise it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the moment, the doors to the laboratory bang open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Activists all turn. Standing at the entrance is the Scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. The Scientist jumps to a telephone handset on th wall and shouts into the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security! We have a break-in! Get to sector...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand slams down the disconnect button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief Activist plucks the receiver from the Scientist hands, and then rips the telephone from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are, I know what you think you're doing, but you have to listen to me. You can't release these animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't want to get hurt, shut your mouth, and don't move a fucking muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chimps are infected!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Activists hesitate, exchanging a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; stumbling,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These animals are highly contagious. They've been given an inhibitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Infected with what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chemically restricted, locked down to a... a single impulse that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Infected with what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scientist hesitates before answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the Activists, the bank of monitors show the faces the machete-wielding crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately trying to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to cure, you must first understand. Just imagine: to have power over all the things we feel we can't control. Anger, violence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is he talking about? 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time for this shit! Get the cages open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going, you sick bastard, and we're taking your torture victims with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! You must listen! The animals are contagious! The infection is in their blood and saliva! One bite and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't bite me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Female Activist crouches down to face the wild eyes o the infected chimp behind the perspex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOP! You have no idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scientist makes a desperate lunge towards her, but th Chief Activist grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy. You don't want to bite me, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Female Activist gives a final benign smile, then the Finnish Activist pops open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a bullet from a gun, the infected chimp leaps out at Female Activist - and sinks its teeth into her neck. She reels back as the chimp claws and bites with extraordinar viciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the same moment, a deafening alarm begins to sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it off! Get if off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Finnish Activist rips the ape off and throws it on to floor. The infected chimp immediately bites into the man' leg. He yells with pain, and tries to kick it off. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, the Female Activist has started to scream. Sh doubles up, clutching the side of her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm burning! Jesus! Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to kill her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm burning! I'm burning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to kill her NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the Female Activist's cries have become an unwavering howl of pain - and she is joined by the Finnis Activist, whose hands have also flown to the side of his head, gripping his temples as if trying to keep his skull from exploding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scientist grabs a desk-lamp base and starts running towards the screaming Female Activist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who has ripped off her balaclava - revealing her face the face of an Infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to the Scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaps at him. He screams as they go tumbling to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief Activist watches in immobile horror as she atta the Scientist with amazing ferocity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another ACTIVIST makes his way down the corridor towards lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry? Jemma? 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mika? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches the door to the lab, which is closed - and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as he opens it, we realize the door is also soundproof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall of screaming hits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands in the doorway - stunned by the noise, and then sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood, death, and his colleagues, all Infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Infected rush him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up of Jim, a young man in his twenties, wearing pal green hospital pyjamas. He has a month's beard, is dishevelled, and asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back to see that Jim is lying on a hospital bed, private room. Connected to his arms are multiple drips, a full row of four or five on each side of his bed. Most of bags are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around with an expression of confusion. Then he up. He is weak, but he swings his legs off the bed and stands. The attached drips are pulled with him and clatte the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim winces, and pulls the taped needles from his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice is hoarse, his mouth dry. Massaging his throat, walks to the door. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Jim's hospital room is locked. The key is on floor. He picks it up and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim exits into a corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far end, a sign read: COMA WARD. There is no sign life or movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks down the corridor. One of the doors is half-ope From inside, there is the sound of buzzing flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim moves as quickly as he can through the hospital, stil weak, but now driven by adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the wards and corridors are deserted. Medical notes a equipment lie strewn over the floors, trolleys are upende glass partition doors are smashed. In a couple of places, splashes of dried blood arc up the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches A&E. On one wall is a row of public pay ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts a receiver, and the line is dead. He goes down t line, trying them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner of the A&E reception is a smashed soft- machine, with a few cans collected at the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim grabs one, rips off the ring-pull and downs it in one Then he grabs another, and heads for the main doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim exits and walks out into the bright daylight of the forecourt. The camera begins to pull away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aside from a quiet rush of wind, there is silence. No traffic, no engines, no movement. Not even birdsong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks through the empty city, from St. Thomas's Hospi over Westminster Bridge, past the Houses of Parliament, d Whitehall, to Trafalgar Square. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright overhead sun bleaches the streets. A light drift litter and refuse. Cars lie abandoned, shops looted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is still wearing his hospital pyjamas, and carries a plastic bag full of soft-drink cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks. Night has fallen. He needs to find a place to rest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses. Down a narrow side street is a church. He walk towards it. The front doors are open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks inside, moving with the respectful quietness th people adopt when entering a church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors ahead to the main chamber are closed. Pushing t gently trying the handle, it is obvious they are locked. another open door is to his left. He goes through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim moves up a stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Written large on the wall is a single line of graffiti:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim moves into the gallery level, and sees, through the d and rot, ornate but faded splendor. At the far end, a sta glass window is illuminated by the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim pads in, stands at the gallery, facing the stained-gl window for a moment before looking down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath are hundreds of dead bodies. Layered over the flo jammed into the pews, spilling over the altar. The scene an unimaginable massacre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stands, stunned. Then sees, standing motionless at different positions facing away from him, four people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their postures and stillness make their status unclear. J hesitates before speaking. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately, the four heads flick around. Infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the next moment, there is the powerful thump of a doo the far end of the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim whirls to the source as the Infected below start to m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door thumps again - another stunningly powerful blow, noise echoing around the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, fist closing around his bag of soft drinks, Jim steps onto the gallery, facing the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and it smashes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revealing an Infected Priest - who locks sight on Jim, an starts to sprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priest is half way across the gallery

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, what are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now the moonlight catches the Priest's face. Showing clearly: the eyes. The blood smeared and collected around nose, ears, and mouth. Darkened and crusted, accumulated days and weeks. Fresh blood glistening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a movement of pure instinct, Jim swings the bag just a the Priest is about to reach him - and connects squarely the man's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that, was bad, that was bad... I shouldn't have done that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks into a run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the stairwell... 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...into the front entrance, where the locked door now str under the blows of the Infected inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim sprints down the stone steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he reaches the bottom the doors are broken open, and t Infected give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim runs - the Infected have almost reached him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand fires up a Zippo lighter, and lights the rag of a Molotov cocktail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jim runs, something flies past his head, and the Infec closest to him explodes in a ball of flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim turns, and sees as another Molotov cocktail explodes, engulfing two in the fireball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whirls, now completely bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Molotov cocktail explodes. The Infected stagger f the blaze, on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim whirls again, and sees, further down the road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Selena, a black woman, also in her twenties. She wears small backpack, a machete is stuck into her belt - and sh holds a lit Molotov cocktail in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mark, a tall, good-looking man - throwing another bott

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It smashes on the head of the last Infected, bathing it i flame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The burning Infected bumps blindly into a car. Falls. Get again. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blindly, it staggers off the road, into a petrol station where an abandoned car has run over on the pumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground beneath it suddenly ignites, and the petrol station explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena and Mark lead Jim into a side street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those people! Who were... who...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way! Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim allows himself to be hurried along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena stops outside a newsagent's shop. The shop's door windows are covered with a metal security grill, but the grill over the door lock has been prised away enough for Selena to slip her hand through to the latch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, most of the shelves have been emptied of confectionery. Newspapers and magazines litter the floor. magazine covers of beautiful girls and sports cars have become instant anachronisms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the back of the shop, a makeshift bed of sheets and sleeping bag is nestled. This has obviously been Selena a Mark's home for the last few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Mark and Selena enter the newsagent's and pull down grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man walks into a bar with a giraffe. They each get pissed. The giraffe falls over. The man goes to leave and the barman says, you can't leave that lying there. The man says, it's not a lion. It's a giraffe. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark pulls off his mask and turns to Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's completely humorless. You two will get along like a house on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena, who has already taken off her mask, ignores Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? You've come from a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a doctor. He's a patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a bicycle courier. I was riding a package from Farringdon to Shaftesbury Avenue. A car cut across me... and then I wake up in hospital, today... I wake up and I'm hallucinating, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mark. This is Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jim. We've got some bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena starts to tell her story, and as the story unfolds see the images she describes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It began as rioting. And right from the beginning, you knew something bad was going on because the rioters were killing people. And then it wasn't on the TV anymore. It was in the street outside. It was coming through your windows. We all guessed it was a virus. An infection. You didn't need a doctor to tell you that. It was the blood. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something in the blood. By the time they tried to evacuate the cities, it was already too late. The infection was everywhere. The army blockades were overrun. And that was when the exodus started. The day before the radio and TV stopped broadcasting there were reports of infection in Paris and New York. We didn't hear anything more after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are your families?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours will be dead too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... No! I'm going to find them. They live in Greenwich. I can walk. (heading for the exit) I'm going to... to go and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll go and come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling at the grill) Yes! I'll go and come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rules of survival. Lesson one - you never go anywhere alone, unless you've got no choice. Lesson two - you only move during daylight, unless you've got no choice. We'll take you tomorrow. Then we'll all go and find your dead parents. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena and Mark walk along the Docklands Light Railw in single file. Ahead is a train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the train, as if spilled in its wake, are abandone bags, suitcases, backpacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark drops pace to let Jim catch up. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your head? Fucked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing at the city) I know where your head is. You're looking at these windows, these millions of windows, and you're thinking - there's no way this many people are dead. It's just too many windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark picks up a handbag from the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The person who owned this bag. Can't be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark reaches in and starts to pull things out as they wal discarding the personal possessions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman - (car keys) - who drove a Nissan Micra - (teddy) - and had a little teddy bear - (condoms) - and carried protection, just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marks tosses the condoms behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, we won't need them anymore than she will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the bag to Jim and walks ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim pulls out a mobile phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He switches it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It reads: SEARCHING FOR NETWORK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message blinks a couple of times. Then the screen goe blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is now alongside the train. The inside of the windows smeared with dried blood. Pressed against the glass is th face of a dead man. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim drops the phone and breaks into a run - running past and Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena and Mark jog across Greenwich Common. Jim gestures towards one of the streets on the far side of th green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down there. Westlink Street. Second on the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is modest red-brick semi-detached houses. They stand outside Number 43. Jim waits while Selena scans the dark facade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's anyone in there who isn't human...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena shoots a glance at Jim. Jim is gazing at the house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim uses the key under the flowerpot to open the back doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena and Mark move quietly through the kitchen and downstairs of the house. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprisingly, everything is neat and tidy. Washed plates stacked by the sink, newspapers on the table are neatly piled. The headline on the top paper reads simply: CONTAINMENT FAILS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the bottom of the stairs. Selena gestures upwa and Jim nods. They start to ascend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the stairs, Selena sniffs the air, and reco Jim has noticed it too. His eyes widen in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jim pushes past and advances along the top landing, u he reaches a door. By now the smell is so bad that he is having to cover his nose and mouth with the sleeve of one arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim pushes open the door. Inside, two decomposed bodies l side by side on the bed, intertwined. On the bedside tabl are an empty bottle of sleeping pills and a bottle of red wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark appears behind him. Jim stares at his parents for a couple of moments, then Mark closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim sits on the toilet, alone. He is crying. In his hand piece of paper: "Jim - with endless love, we left you sleeping. Now we're sleeping with you. Don't wake up."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paper crumples in his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena and Mark sit in the living room, on the two sofas. Jim looks dazed, uncomprehending. Selena watches J her expression neutral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They died peacefully. You should be grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's words hang a moment. Then Mark talks, simply, unemotionally, matter-of-fact throughout. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roads out were all jammed. So we went to Paddington Station. Hoping: maybe we could get to Heathrow, maybe buy our way on a plane. My dad had all this cash, even though cash was already useless, and Mum had her jewellery. But twenty thousand other people had the same idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd was surging, and I lost my grip on my sister's hand. I remember realizing the ground was soft. I looked down, and I was standing on people. Like a carpet, people who had fallen, and... somewhere in the crowd there were infected. It spread fast, no one could run, all you could do was climb. Over more people. So I did that. I got up, somehow, on top of a kiosk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down, you couldn't tell which faces were infected and which weren't. With the blood, the screaming, they all looked the same. And I saw my dad. Not my mum or my sister. But I saw my dad. His face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena's right. You should be grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time to get back to the shop before dark. We should stay here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim nods. He isn't sure what he wants to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My old room was at the end of the landing. You two take it. I'll sleep down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll sleep in the same room. It's safer. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red orb of the sun goes down; the light fades. As nig falls, London vanishes into blackness, with no electric l to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the moon appears from behind the cloud layer, and th dark city is revealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is on the sofa. In the moonlight, we can see that his eyes are open, wide awake. Selena is curled on the other sofa, and Mark is on the floor - both asleep. The house i silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim watches Selena sleeping for a couple of moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, quietly, he gets off the sofa and pads out of the living room, down the hall to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim enters, standing just inside the doorway. He looks ar the room. On one wall, a faded kid's drawing of a car is framed. Above the counter, on a shelf of cookery books, a album has a handwritten label on the spine: "Mum's Favori Recipes".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks to the fridge. Stuck to the door is a photo of with his parents, arm in arm, smiling at the camera. Jim on his mountain bike, wearing his courier bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, sitting at the kitchen table as his Mum enters, carr bags of shopping. Jim walks over to the bags and pulls ou carton of orange juice, which he pulls straight to his mo and begins to gulp down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Dad walks in from the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a glass of that, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (draining the carton, and giving it a shake) It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim touches the photo, their faces, lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is facing away from the back door, which has a large frosted-glass panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the glass panel, unseen by Jim a dark silhouette looms against the diffused glow from the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the kitchen window, a second silhouette appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there is a scratching noise from the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, he turns his head, and sees the dark shapes behin the door and window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat - then the door is abruptly and powerfully smashed It flies open, and hangs loosely held by the bottom hinge Standing in the doorframe is an Infected Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim shouts with alarm as the Man lunges at him - and they both go tumbling to the floor. At the same moment, the fi behind the kitchen window smashes the glass, and an Infec Teenage Girl starts to clamber through the jagged frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man gets on top of Jim, while Jim uses his arms to ho back the ferocious assault. A single strand of saliva fli from the Man's lips, and contacts Jim's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Selena is there, holding her machete. The blade flashes down to the back of the Man's neck. Blood gushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim rolls the Infected Man off, just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mark dispatch the Girl half way through the kitchen window. The Girl is holding Mark, but her legs are caught the broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark jabs upwards into the Girl's torso - she stiffens, t slumps, and as Mark steps back we see he is holding a kni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim hyperventilates, staring at the corpse on the kitchen floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mr. Bridges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena turns to Jim. She is hyperventilating too, but the is control and steel in her voice. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you bitten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lives four doors down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim turns to the Girl sprawled half way through the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you bitten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks at her. Selena is still holding her machete at ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... No! I wasn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did any of the blood get in your mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim turns to Mark. He is standing in the middle of the ro Stepped away from the window. The Girl's blood is on his and he is wiping it away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...off the skin... where a long scratch cut wells up fres blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Mark looks at Selena, as if slightly startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Selena is swiping with her machete. Mark lifts his ar instinctively, defensively, and the blade sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena immediately yanks it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena swipes again - and the blade catches Mark hard in side of the head. Mark falls. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim watches, scrabbling backwards on the floor away from them, as Selena brutally finishes Mark off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena looks at Mark's body for a couple of beats, then lowers the blade. She picks up a dishcloth from the sink counter and tosses it to Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that cleaned off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim picks up the rag and hurriedly starts to wipe the Infected's blood from around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any clothes here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fazed, frightened of her) I... I don't know. I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get them. And get dressed. We have to leave, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With practiced speed, Selena starts to open the kitchen cupboards, selecting packets of biscuits and cans from th shelves, and stuffing them into her backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More infected will be coming. They always do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena exit the front door. Jim has changed out o his hospital gear into jeans and a sweatshirt. He also ha small backpack, and is carrying a baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena walk: fast, alert. But something is not be said between them... until Jim breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena says nothing. Continues walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know he was infected? 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood was everywhere. On me, on you, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know he was infected. Okay? I didn't know. He knew. I could see it in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to understand, if someone gets infected, you've got somewhere between ten and twenty seconds to kill them. They might be your brother or your sister or your oldest friend. It makes no difference Just so as you know, if it happens to you, I'll do it in a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long had you known him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five days. Or six. Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was full of plans. Long-distance weapons, so they don't get close. A newsagent's with a metal grill, so you can sleep. Petrol bombs, so the blood doesn't splash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena looks at Jim dispassionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a plan yet, Jim? You want us to find a cure and save the world? Or fall in love and fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena looks away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plans are pointless. Staying alive is as good as it gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk. Jim following a few steps behind Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few moments later, Jim lifts a hand, opens his mouth, a to say something - but Selena cuts him off without even looking round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has seen something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of tower blocks some distance away, standing again the night sky. In one of them, hanging in the window of o of the highest stories, colored fairy lights are lit up, blinking gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena walk through the smashed glass doors of th tower block. It is extremely dark inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena switches on a flashlight and illuminates the entra hall. It is a mess. The floor is covered in broken glass dried blood. The lift doors are jammed open, and inside i dense bundle of rags - perhaps an old corpse, but impossi to tell, because the interior of the lift has been torche It is black with carbon, and smoke-scarring runs up the outside wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena moves the flashlight to the stairwell. There is a tangle of shopping trolleys running up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena gives one of the trolleys an exploratory tug. It shifts, but holds fast, meshed in with its neighbor. Then puts a foot into one of the grates, and lifts herself up. Shining her light over the top of the tangle, she can see gap along the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope we don't have to get out of here in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to climb through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena move steadily and quietly up the stairwell into the building. Reaching a next landing, they check ar the corner before proceeding. Through a broken window, we see that they are already high above most London building and on the wall a sign reads: LEVEL 5. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely out of breath) No. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue a few steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do need a break, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena nods. They stop on the stairs. Jim slips off his backpack and sits, pulling a face as he does so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a cut-the-crap expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say something before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I didn't think you'd give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment, where it's unclear how Selena will react to thi Then she slips off her own backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going through the bag) You've got no fat on you, and all you've had to eat is sugar. So you're crashing. Unfortunately, there isn't a lot we can do about that... 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena starts to produce a wide selection of pills, loote from a chemist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...except pump you full painkillers, and give you more sugar to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up a bottle of codeine tablets, and passes it t Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for the sugar: Lilt or Tango?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Do you have Sprite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I did have a can of Sprite, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there is a loud scream, coming from somewhere lo down the building. Jim and Selena both make a grab for th weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scream comes again. The noise is chilling, echoing up empty stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there is something strange about it. The noise is hum but oddly autistic. It is held for slightly too long, and stops abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, the sound of metal scraping, clattering the blockad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Infected, a Young Asian Guy and a Young White Guy, mo with amazing speed over the blockade. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena sprint up the stairs. Behind them, we can the Infected, giving chase, howling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass level eight, nine, ten...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath, barely able to speak) I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena continues, and Jim looks over the edge of the stairwell, to the landing below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where the two Infected appear, tearing around the corn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena sprints up the stairs... and Jim sprints past her, an amazing burst of energy and speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round another bend in the stairwell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then both Jim and Selena scream. Standing directly in front of them is a Man In Riot Cop Gear - helmet with ful visor, gloves, a riot shield in one hand, and a length of lead pipe in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man lunges past both of them, barging past, where the Infected White Man has appeared at the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Riot Gear Man swings his lead pipe and connects vicio with the White Man's head. The White Man falls backwards against the Asian Man. Both fall back down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Riot Gear Man turns back to Jim and Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the corridor! Flat 157!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena are stunned, but start to run down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Asian Man is coming back up the stairs. Jim looks bac over his shoulder in time to see the Riot Gear Man delive massive blow to the Asian Man's head. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena run towards Flat 157. The door is open, bu they approach, it suddenly slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: JIM AND SELENA
dialogues.text: (hammering on the door) Let us in!

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens a fraction, on the chain. The face of a gi appears. She is fourteen, pale, solemn-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks back down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far end, the Man appears. He is holding the limp b of one of the Infected - and he tips it over the balcony, where it drops down the middle of the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Hannah. Let them inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes, we hear the chain being slipped off, the opens again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena enter past the pale-faced girl. The flat i council, three-bed, sixteenth floor of the block. It has patterned wallpaper, and nice but boring furnishings. It lit by candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entrance hall leads straight to the living room, whic has French windows and a small balcony outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one wall, a framed photograph hangs, which shows the M standing beside a black taxi cab. Next to him is a middle aged woman - presumably the Man's wife. Hannah sits at th cab's steering wheel, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another photo, beside, show Hannah sat in the seat of a g kart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man follows Jim and Selena inside. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow the Man through to the living room, and Hanna recloses the front door, which has an impressive arrangem of locks and dead-bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the living room, the fairy lights hang in the window, powered by a car battery. Lit by their glow, the Man goes through a careful ritual of shedding his gear, helped by Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, he lays down the riot shield. Then he puts the bloodsmeared lead pipe on a small white towel. Next, he removes his gloves - and places them beside the bar on th towel. Then he folds the towel over the weapon and gloves and puts it beside the riot shield. Finally he removes th visored helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena watch him. They look pretty rattled, not really knowing what to expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the Man has finished shedding his gear, he turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... I'm Frank, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends his hand to Jim and Selena. Jim hesitates very briefly, then shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank beams, and suddenly he seems much less frightening imposing. If anything, he is just as nervous as Jim and Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena. Good to meet you. And this is my daughter, Hannah. (turning to Hannah) ...Come on, sweetheart. Say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah takes a step into the room, but says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... so this is great. Just great. It calls for a celebration. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say. Why don't you all sit down, and... Hannah, what have we got to offer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got Mum's creme de menthe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, her creme de menthe. Great. Look, sit, please. Get comfortable. Sit tight while I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank exits. Selena, Jim and Hannah all stand, until Sele gestures at the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena take the sofa. Hannah stays standing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Where are the bloody glasses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middle cupboard.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No! The good ones! This is a celebration!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top cupboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another short, uncomfortable pause. Hannah looks at Jim a Selena from her position near the doorway. Her expression blank and unreadable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your place, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank re-enters. Frank is beaming, holding the creme de menthe, and four wine glasses. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! I know it isn't much but... well, cheers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon shines above the tower block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena and Hannah all sit in the living room, sippin creme de menthe. Frank is disconnecting the fairy lights he talks, and pulling the curtains closed, rather systematically checking for cracks along the edges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally we keep the windows covered at night, because the light attracts them. But when we saw your petrol station fire, we knew it had to be survivors... So we hooked up the Christmas tree lights. Like a beacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished with the sofa, he sits on the armchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're grateful you came. I was starting to really worry. Like I say, we haven't seen any sign of anyone normal for a while now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't any others in the building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you haven't seen any people outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's eyes flick to Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't left the block for more than two weeks. Stayed right here. Only sensible thing to do. Everyone who went out... 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's two hundred flats here. Most of them have a few cans of food, or cereal, or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good set-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a hand on Hannah's shoulder, and gives it a squee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got by, haven't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is in the bathroom, inspecting himself in the mirror. is just finishing shaving his beard off, and has had to u the razor dry. He has cut himself several times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim does a couple of last dry strokes with the razor, and winces as he cuts himself again. He uses spit to wipe awa the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, from outside, Frank speaks.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You okay in there, Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Fine.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry we couldn't spare the water but... it's the same with the toilet. The, er, flush doesn't work. I'm afraid you have to use the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to empty it each morning. We just chuck it over the balcony... No mod cons here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well, look, it's pretty late. I'm going to turn in. We've got a spare room. Are you and Selena...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. I mean, yes... So, good night then, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank smiles, and heads to his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim feels his way down the dark corridor back to the candlelit living room. Selena is standing by the window. looks around when Jim enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very spruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very shredded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim sits on the armchair, and Selena moves to look at a picture on the wall - the photo of Frank's family and the black cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you make of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're desperate. Probably need us more than we need them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I think they're good people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's nice. But you should be more concerned about whether they're going to slow you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Because if they slowed you down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd leave them behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're going to wind up getting yourself killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. Then Selena stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena - you think I don't get it. But I do get it. And I know I'd be dead already if I hadn't met you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena hesitates at the door - then turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, look - I mean thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I mean sure. Good night, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits, leaving Jim alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks around the room, blowing out the candles. He le one burning beside the sofa. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he slides open the French doors and exits out onto t balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city is spread out in front Jim. In the distance, to north, the petrol station still burns, sending billowing clouds of sparks high into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim sits on the armchair, facing the window, nursing a ca Lilt. Outside, the sky has just started to brighten with first light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, have you got a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Jim appear from a service door. The view over London is spectacular - low clouds catching the sunrise, a plume of smoke still drifting up from the petrol statio blaze. But more noticeable is that the entire roof area i covered in buckets, pans, bowls, plates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost water pressure three weeks ago. For a while, I thought we'd be okay with the water in the other flats. The cistern and tanks. But it vanishes so quick you wouldn't believe. You drink it, it evaporates, turns stagnant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the pans) They're all empty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hasn't rained in over a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits, watching Jim. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can set up a plastic sheet to catch dew and condensation. Trap it somehow. I saw it on TV once and I've been experimenting, but I can't get it to work, and... you don't happen to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd never think it. Needing rain so badly... Not in fucking England... (he breaks off) Jim, we don't have enough water for and Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena, Frank and Hannah all sit in the living room. Frank is on the armchair. On the coffee table in front of is a small radio. He turns it on - producing a fuzz of ra static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There haven't been any broadcasts for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They listen. Through the static, the sound of a voice beg to sift through.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The answer to infection is here... if you can hear this, you're not alone... there are others like you... other survivors... we are soldiers, we are armed and we can protect you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Male Voice fades into the static. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more. Listen.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Our location is the forty-second blockade, M602, twenty-seven miles north-east of Manchester... you must find us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it just repeats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a recording?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank switches the radio off, and produces a map of Brita which he opens on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a recording. But this is where it's telling us to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank points to the location described.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The North...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way things are, we might need two or three days to get up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. Then Frank gives a short, embarrassed laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound carries in this flat. Jerry- built, I suppose, and... me and Hannah do need you more than you need us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Look, it's the truth. I can't leave the block if it's just the two of us. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If something happened to me, Hannah would be alone. But if we were with other people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets the sentence hang, gazing at Jim and Selena with undisguised hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's a recording, for all we know the soldiers who made it are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that stuff about the answer to infection. There is no answer to infection. It's already done pretty much all the damage it can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they've got a cure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they've got nothing at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way to find out is to reach them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could die trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or die here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah speaks so rarely that her interjection seems to ta everyone by surprise. Including her. For a moment she loo flustered, but then she continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And anyway, it isn't true what Dad said. You need us just the same as we need you. We need each other. And we'll never be safe in the cities, and soldiers could keep us safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses for a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we have to try and get there. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get there how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black London cab drives fast out of the tower block's underground garage, bursting into the daylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah and Selena sit on the back seat, and Jim sits on t fold-down. Frank smiles, starts the meter running, and le around to his passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so as you know. I don't take cheques or credit cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank drives through the destroyed streets of the capital

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass a stray Infected, through the smashed window of shop. It's head flicks around at the noise of the cab's engine, and starts to move, but the cab is moving too fas catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab pulls up at the entrance of a tunnel that leads u the river Thames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the most direct route to the other side of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we should go the indirect route. The one in broad daylight. That isn't underground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just get it done. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank floors the accelerator and they head into the tunne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank drives through the tunnel. Wrecked cars and debris illuminated in the headlights, and Frank weaves expertly between them. His passengers roll with the movement of th cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew this was a shit idea. You know why? Because it was really obviously a shit idea. Driving into a dark tunnel, full of smashed cars and broken glass is really fucking obviously a shit idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jim speaks, out of the gloom, caught in the headlights huge pile of cars appears, stretching across the full wid of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank slams his foot down on the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab bumps up onto the barricade and drives over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab bumps down the other side of the barricade, with cheer from the passengers - but the jubilation only lasts moment, because the cab his the road hard, on to a carpet broken glass, and the front left tire blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank saws the wheel, but loses control. The cab scrapes along the side of an abandoned car, then slews to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank tries accelerating again, but the cab immediately p left, back into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank jumps out of the cab, and shines his flashlight aro the tunnel. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world's worst place to get a flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreed. I think we'd better do this quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank opens the boot and puts the jack into Hannah's hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah immediately runs to the front of the cab and hunch down. Meanwhile, Frank unclips the spare and hauls it out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena stand at the back of the cab, weapons read shining their flashlights into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the front of the cab, Hannah pumps the jack, but it is moving with aching slowness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the back of the cab, Jim and Selena wait nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a noise from further down the tunnel, in the direction which they came. A scrabbling rush of movement but too quiet to be humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You heard that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the front of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is about to answer. Then is eyes widen. He looks down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tide of rats is rushing under their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the rats rush around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck? 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're running from the infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if in answer, the howls of the Infected echo down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah desperately positions the jack underneath the cab, the rates run over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah, get out, get out! (to Jim and Selena) Just lift it! LIFT IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena, and Frank get their hands under the side of cab, and pull upwards. The cab rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah, with great skill and speed, fits the new tire, li pit-stop mechanic at a grand prix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straining with the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hannah puts an expert twist on the last wheel nut, the cab's back lights pick up the faces of the Infected spill over the barricade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lunge back into the cab, just as the nearest Infecte slams against the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cab races off, Jim leans out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the Infected) Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank slams his foot down, and they tear off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab races out. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you're a cab driver's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab drives through London, the meter steadily clockin upwards. Driving, Frank's eyes flick down to the fuel gau It is under a quarter full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green shoots are pushing through the cracks in the paveme and road, as nature begins to reclaim the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high street. Suddenly Selena cranes around, seeing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Stop the cab! Stop the cab!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have stopped outside of a supermarket. The windows a dark, but unbroken, and it looks as if there is still foo the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un. Believable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door to the cab, holding her machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place hasn't been looted. It's a gold mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we don't know what's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food and drink is what's in there. And we need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been living off Mars Bars and Coke for two weeks. I need some tinned fruit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena tries the door of the supermarket. It swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter silently. All carry their weapons at the ready

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They peer down the aisles. The supermarket is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena, Frank, and Hannah all split off with shoppin trolleys. They look like kids in a toy store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena taking cans off the shelves, three at a time, goin down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have you, you, you, you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim taking more stuff off shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena appears at the top of the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take anything we need to cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks at the item in his hand. It is caviar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I think you can eat this stuff raw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, standing by the fruit and vegetable section, in fr of a bank of rotting apples - marked ORGANIC. Beside is a pile of apples that look fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Irradiated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena finding Hannah by a huge array of chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. If I never see chocolate again, it'll be too soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, as something catches her eye. She whips it off th shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not counting Terry's Chocolate Orange, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a handful of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Yorkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Yorkies, obviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim by the drinks counter, examining the label on a bottl whisky, as Frank appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that back. We can't just take any crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't any crap. It's whisky. It might be good to have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's arguing about whisky? I'm saying, don't get a cheap blend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank takes a bottle of Lagavulin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Single malt. Eighteen-year-old. Dark, full flavor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim starts to back his trolley away. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warm, but not aggressive. Peaty after taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena, Frank, and Hannah shopping, pushing their fu trolleys past the empty checkout desks. As Frank passes t till, he slaps down a credit card, and they walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fully loaded cab drives away from the supermarket, ri low on the suspension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab reaches the on-ramp to the Westway, and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could have a problem here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab sits at the back of an apparent traffic jam leadi onto the Westway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both sides of the dual carriageway are jam-packed with abandoned cars, a deserted gridlock. All cars point in th same direction - out of town. Some of the cars are crashe riding up on each other, rolled over, burned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the camera rises upwards, we can see that the gridlock snakes along the entire distance of the flyover. Like the destroyed vehicles on the road to Basra, it stretches for miles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. We're never going to be able to get out of London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you worry about that. I've sat twenty years in this seat. I've got my routes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montage of the cab sweeping through suburban London, cutt down side streets, ducking down alleys, sometimes passing under the Westway flyover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the montage, we see scenes of devastation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim gazes out of the window as the cab passes a huge clus of rotting corpses, collected under and in the scoop of a abandoned bulldozer. The dead operator of the bulldozer l a few feet away from his cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The montage ends on: the cab bumping down a steep grass v onto the motorway.

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Nice cut-through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab drives down the motorway. There are still vehicle scattered crashed, but fewer and fewer as distance is gai on the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE DASHBOARD, the needle on the fuel gauge drifts dow the red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck lay-by approaches, with a shabby shack-style cafe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign outside the cafe reads: CHEESEBURGERS'R'US. And beneath: LAST CHEESEBURGERS FOR SIXTY MILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the forecourt are a couple of vehicles. A people-carri family car, and a truck, slewed off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank slows the cab to a halt, some hundred meters away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We either do this now, or we're walking. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone exits the cab. Selena takes a jerry can and a le of plastic tube from the boot, and Frank gives the igniti keys to Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything goes wrong, you just drive. You put your foot down. And go as far as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me, Hannah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Jim, and Selena begin to walk towards the service station, holding their weapons at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously, Frank, Jim and Selena approach the truck. The is no sign of life around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay close, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Jim and Selena stand guard, Frank works quickly. He prises the fuel cap off, inserts the tube, sucks into the tube, and spits as the diesel begins to flow into the jer can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah watches from the driver's seat. She has her hands the wheel, and is sliding her hands over the plastic, mak a series of imaginary turns, shifting gears... 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they wait for the can to fill, Jim tosses his bat into air, giving it a single flip, catching it as the handle c back around...being a bit flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena notices, and does not look impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost in response to her nonplussed gaze, Jim begins to towards the cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim points his bat in the direction of the cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got enough food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have any cheeseburgers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Stay close." It's like going on holiday with your fucking aunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks inside the cafe, and finds the aftermath of carnage. Decomposed bodies lie scattered, on and under tables: a couple of men, a female cook, and a young famil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks towards the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The father sits wedged between the seats and the table, w are both bolted to the floor. His neck is snapped, head hanging backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother lies a couple of feet away, on the floor, half over an infant, as if in a final protective gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks down at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there is a noise behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instinctively Jim snaps around, swinging the bat as he do so - and connects against a small body, which flies backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only then do we - and Jim - see what he has hit. Crumpled motionless on the ground is an Infected Kid, an eight yea old boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. Jim looks stunned, appalled. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the Infected Kid's eyes flick open. Still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's baseball bat swings down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The can is full. Frank removes the tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find anything, Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena lets it pass - and the moment is broken as Frank stands with the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts a hand to Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah smiles, turns the ignition, and throws the cab int gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab tears towards Jim, Selena and Frank, then - at th last moment - flips into a handbrake turn, and drifts to neat stop, a couple of meters from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning out of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a cab driver's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Ayrton Senna's bloody daughter. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab drives down the motorway, fuel needle pressed up against the full mark. The meter runs up a tab of over th hundred pounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass a sign for MANCHESTER - 130 MILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The occupants have settled into the reflective silence of long drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena seems lost in thought. She looks at Jim, who has h hand stuck out the window, and is using his hand like an aerofoil, catching the wind, dipping and rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
