dialogues.text: Then she looks at Frank, and notices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Frank glance in the rear-view mirror at Hannah, who catches her dad's eye. Frank smiles, and gives her a wink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab drives along A-roads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is looking through some of the bags of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's unbelievably hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks out of the window. They are in completely empty rolling countryside, stretching for miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a picnic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have stopped in a beautiful spot, quite high, clear view. It is a beautiful day. The late afternoon sunshine bright over the green fields, trees cast long shadows. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is happily sat on the grass, eating from their hoard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim has pulled open a packet of stale hot-cross bun; Hann empties a packet of Maltesers into her mouth; Frank holds block of cheddar, taking bites from the cheese as if it w cake ; Selena drinks from a can of tinned peaches, swallo the pieces almost whole, with the juice running down her chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, yes. I can taste the vitamin C. I can feel it in my blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cracking a bun in half) These are great. They're like huge biscuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers half to Hannah, who takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. They are like biscuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: unintelligible, mouth full, spraying crumbs) An de phraisins ar phrill moipht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah and Selena laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, the raisins are still moist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena and Hannah laugh again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look over there. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some distance away, in the fields below, a group of three horses - two adults and a foal - are galloping over the fields as if wild. A majestic and surreal sight, and it somehow implies the way the world will change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they're infected?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think they're doing just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horses gallop, leaping a stone wall, and away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meal has been eaten. Frank sits, playing with his rad trying to listen to the faint broadcast. Beside him, Hann lies on her back, eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena have walked a little distance away from th others, and are sitting on a fence gate, looking over the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I was thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena considers this a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were thinking that you'll never hear another piece of original music ever again. You'll never read a book that isn't already written. Or see a film that isn't already shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you were thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I was thinking I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what? 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena doesn't reply for a moment. Then she turns to look Frank and Hannah - who look oddly normal, surrounded by t food wrappers from the picnic, Frank listening to the rad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the death, all the shit - it doesn't really mean anything for Frank and Hannah. Because she's got her dad, and he's got his daughter, so... it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back at Jim) I was wrong when I told you that staying alive is as good as it gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I was thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. You stole my thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena leans over and gives Jim a light kiss on the cheek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling back at Jim) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly surprised, but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank switches off the radio. He looks over at Hannah, wh dozing peacefully, then over to Jim and Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting late. We should stay here the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim raises a hand in reply. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab sits, parked up at the picnic spot. Jim, Selena, Frank and Hannah lie beside it, wrapped in their jackets, using their small backpacks as pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon is bright, and only Selena is asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor can I. It doesn't feel safe, outdoors like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're safe enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of moments pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Selena didn't seem to have any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I noticed that too. (reaching over and shaking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena...Selena!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what is it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you manage to get to sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena gives a dozy grumble, then sits up, reaches into h backpack, and pulls out several bottles of pills. She han one of them to Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody hell. You must have needed a hell of a prescription for that lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't need a prescription. I'm a qualified chemist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops back down and goes straight back to sleep. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inspecting the bottle) Valium. Great. Not only will it get us to sleep, but if we get attacked during the night, we won't even care. (pops the lid) Two each?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da-ad, plee-ease. I can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. Give her half of one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is riding his bike through the city. It's London back normal, pre-infection. Busy streets, traffic, pedestrians car horns, radios playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim rides fast, his courier bag over his shoulder, weavin between cars, shooting a red light, turning a corner into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gower Street. Suddenly, a car pulls out into Jim's path. car brakes hard, and Jim brakes hard, skidding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the two miss each other by a whisker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver flashes into road rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid cunt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver flips Jim the finger, and accelerates away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim remains stopped by the pavement, one foot down for balance, breathing hard. Pedestrians pass. Groups of peop everyday people, walking by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim watches them, noticing their faces. Some talk to each other, or into mobile phones. Some smile, or walk lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few moments, Jim sets off again, seemingly distracted, still watching pedestrians' faces...then two the faces seem to catch his attention. A man and a woman, middle-aged, chatting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's head turns as he passes them, confusion on his face his bike drifting into another lane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...into the path of a second car. The car that hit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's hand is on Jim's shoulder. Jim stirs, half-wakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused, semi-conscious) What...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is sitting beside him - and we see for the first ti that Frank is awake, keeping guard over them while they sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. You're having a bad dream, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's face relaxes a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbled, half-asleep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank raises his eyebrows, then smiles. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is sitting up. The others are all awake. Frank bounci the repaired flat tire to check it, Hannah slipping on a fresh sweatshirt from her backpack, Selena leaning agains the cab, chewing on a chocolate bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, Frank. This is how you catch dew. I'm covered in the fucking stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (packing the spare away) Okay. Let's get rolling. (he checks his watch) If we make good time, we'll be there before midday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab is driving, towards us, then slows to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is looking at something ahead of them. They seem awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be Manchester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, the whole of Manchester. The whole city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fire crews to put it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see what they are looking at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the horizon ahead, there is the glow of a truly massiv fire. The smoke spreads into the sky like the plume from vast, spreading volcano crater. The city burning. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab drives towards the surreal sight. As they drive, flakes begin to fall, drifting past the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it snow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hitting the windscreen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab drives through the ash fall. Through the soft blizzard, they pass a sign for: MANCHESTER - 14 MILES (in opposite lane). The city is behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab drives down a motorway. The ash is still falling, they start to pass bodies by the roadside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the cab there is a sense of real anticipation. Everyone is sitting up, scanning the road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they come over the brow of a hill, and the ash-fall clears like mist parting, to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone. I think this is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty meters down, the road is blockaded. It is obviously military construction - hurriedly put together, but exper built.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind rolls of razor wire are fifteen foot sheets of corrugated iron, held upright by scaffold pipes. In the middle of the blockade there is a gap wide enough to get vehicle through, but concrete blocks force a chicane. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On either side of the road there are sandbag nests. On th corrugated iron, white painted words read: 42ND BLOCKADE. despite the impressive construction, there is no sign of movement or life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try the horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. We might attract the wrong kind of attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab rolls slowly towards the blockade - past many mor bodies, Infected, rotting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It reaches the chicane, and eases around the concrete blo Then it passes through the gap in the corrugated barrier. the other side of the blockade, canvas tents have been erected on the grass verge, and two transporter trucks ar parked. A few packing crates and tarpaulins are also scattered around. But still no signs of life. The blockad appears to have been abandoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franks slows to a halt, but keeps the engine running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or overrun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank flicks the radio on - there is only static. He swit it off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's check it out. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone exits the cab, holding their various weapons. Ji has his baseball bat, Selena has her machete, and Frank h his lead pipe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously, they begin to explore. They first head over t the grass verge and the tents. In front of one of them, Hannah picks up a Bergen backpack. She upends it, and a f clothes fall out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank moves past her, and carefully pulls back the tent f - machete at the ready. Inside, there is a small table, a maps and papers are strewn across the floor. And a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Did they leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim pushes open the flaps of another tent with his baseba bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't all leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, several body bags lie, buzzing with flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena stands several feet away, by one of the packing ca She pulls out a tangle of camouflage webbing, then lets i drop back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this. I think we should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicles. We should check the vehicles first. There has to be something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank jumps down from the back of one of the trucks. Like others, like everything else it is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Nothing here. I can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We should go."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fucking where? What the fuck are we supposed to do? How is this going to fucking end? It's never going to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank cuts himself off. Then, turning from the others, he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks underneath the archway of one of the blockade structures, and sits down. Needing to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head sinks, staring at the ground beneath his legs. A couple of moments later he looks up - and sees that sitti opposite of him, on the other side of the archway, almost mirroring his posture and position, is a dead Infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corpse of the Infected sits gazing back at Frank with sightless eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment between the two of them. A blank-faced exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks left and sees the corpse of another Infected, few feet beyond the blockade. And another, beyond it. And another, a few more feet to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Frank looks upwards. Above him, on the walkway of th blockade, another corpse lies. And this corpse is swarmed with crows, picking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Get out it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bends, picks up a rock and throws it, but misses, sail past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a rage again, Frank goes under the blockade and starts kick it. The scaffold clangs, vibrates, and - startled - crows lift off from the mutilated corpse and fly... 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...dislodging, or disrupting, a single droplet of blood f the corpse, that rolls off the neck, and begins to fall downwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down... to where Frank gazes upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The droplet splashes, pinpoint perfect, on Frank's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank frowns, his hand immediately going to his face. The fingers come away, with the tiny smear of red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad... are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank turns. Hannah is there, with Jim. Selena stands a little way further back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I'm fine, honey. I'm sorry. I just lost my temper. I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank frowns. A hand goes to his temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, the color is draining from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving to Frank) Why? What's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lashes out and shoves Hannah away, knocking her bac the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trickle of blood runs out of Frank's nose. Then he doub up, clutching the side of his head. He screams with pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim... (breaking into a run) Jim, he's infected!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah lunges towards her dad, but is caught by Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding Hannah back) Jim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jim is frozen, holding his baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank screams again. Then drops to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah struggles with Selena, trying to get to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is still frozen, baseball bat half-raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Frank looks up, his face contorted. The infection has taken hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And at that moment there is a rifle report, a rush of air and a rapid thump of impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank falls forwards to the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena lets Hannah go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the GUNFIRE comes again. Three shots in quick succession - into Frank's motionless body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a daze, Hannah starts towards her dead father. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn to see three British soldiers standing by a jeep. One of the soldiers (Farrell) advances, with his gu still raised, while the others (Mitchell and Clifton) hol back giving cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from the man! NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim steps towards Hannah and grabs her, pulling her away Frank's body. She doesn't struggle. She is in a state of absolute shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jeep drives down a small road - away from the blockade. Jim, Selena and Hannah sit in the back. Behind is the cab driven by the Sergeant. A little way ahead of them, the walled grounds of a huge country mansion appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a cast-iron gated entrance, a gravel driveway leads to the impressive country mansion, surrounded by a high perimeter wall. The grounds show acres of lawn and flower beds. These have obviously had many years of very careful cultivation and attention, but now are just starting to l unkempt and overgrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep pulls up by the front steps. Waiting there is another soldier, a major. Like the other soldiers, he is unshaven, but has the authority of command about him, eve the relaxed way that he stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jim, Selena and Hannah dismount from the jeep, he appraises them. Then speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Major Henry West. Welcome. We've got beds with clean sheets and a boiler that produces hot water. So you can all have a shower. You look like you need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena, and tear-streaked Hannah gaze back at Henry blankly. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim has a shower, sees the cab driving round in circles outside the shower window, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks down a sweeping staircase to the front hall. Scattered around are various bits of military gear. A pai muddy boots, a jacket, assorted kit, webbing, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is sitting, looking out over the back lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling back, we see Jim is with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard our broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must be a disappointment. You were hoping for a full brigade. An army base, with helicopters and field hospitals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were hoping for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer to infection. Well, as I said, it's here. Though it may not be quite what you imagined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know what to imagine, so... We just feel lucky to have found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were lucky. The fire drove hundreds of infected out of Manchester. The surrounding area is teeming with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry glances back at Jim. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's no need for you to worry. We're well protected here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry shows Jim around the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three-sixty visibility. Flat terrain all around the house... Floodlights, which we've rigged up to a generator. Don't like to waste the fuel, but when we want to, we can turn night into day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High perimeter wall, which helps, and we've been lacing the grounds with trip wires and land mines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry indicates where Farrell, Smith and Davis can be see running a trip wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't want to go mowing the lawn, but if they get in, we hear them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry leads Jim into the basement level of the mansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secondary to protection, our real job is to rebuild. Start again. Down here is the wood-fired boiler that provides us with hot water. Our first step to civilization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then to a kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here, the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the soldiers are unpacking the food bags from cab. One of the soldiers, Jones, is wearing an apron. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you cooking, Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a surprise, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry leads Jim into a small courtyard, hanging with bloodstained laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laundry starts to billow - and with it we hear the so of rushing movement. As a darkly stained sheet is ripped aside, an Infected is revealed only a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim jumps back, but Henry stays put - as the Infected is suddenly jerked backwards by a chain around its neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...meet Mailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mailer is uniformed. A soldier. Apart from the chain arou his neck, he is gagged with a filthy and blood-blackened tied tight into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mailer, Jim. Jim, Mailer. Got infected three days ago. Mitchell managed to knock him out cold. Got a chain around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're keeping him alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idea was to learn something about infection. Have him teach me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And has he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's teaching me he'll never bake bread. Plant crops, raise livestock. He's telling me he's futureless. And eventually he'll tell me how long the infected take to starve to death. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner's at seven. Don't forget to tell the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry exits, leaving Jim with Mailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mailer lunges at Jim - a moment between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Jim exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carefully, Jim opens the door to the girls' bedroom. Insi is Hannah lying on the bed, face covered, on her side. Se lies behind her, her arm lying protectively over Hannah's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena looks around, sees Jim, and puts a finger to her l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Selena enter, and close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So how is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's lost her dad. That's how she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all fucked, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Selena looks as if she's on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't...do that. Look, Hannah... Hannah's what Frank said she was. Tough. Strong. And just like me, just like you, she will cope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Jim. Just shut up. I don't want her to fucking cope. I want her to be okay. And when Hannah had her dad, it was all okay. Remember? And when it was okay for them, it was okay for us. And now it's all fucked. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Selena's tears are flowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim seems to want to reply, but doesn't have the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead, he lifts Selena's face and kisses her on the lip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Selena pushes him a away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surreal scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner, with full silver service, candles, wine and cryst glasses, napkins, and everyone rather formally sitting wh Jones lays food on the table, wearing an apron over his uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made all the more surreal by Jim and Selena's grubby clot and Hannah's dazed, tear-streaked face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what have we here? Tinned ham, tinned peas, and omelette. You've prepared a feast, Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honor of our guests, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I was going to suggest a toast, but this omelette will do just as well. (cuts off a chunk of omelette and raises it) To new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry pops the omelette in his mouth, then promptly spits out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones, did you notice while cooking that these eggs are off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the salt might cover the taste, sir. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing his plate away) Get rid of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry turns to Hannah as Jones sheepishly exits, carrying omelette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose you can cook, can you? I can't tell you how badly we need someone who shows a little flair in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah ignore/is unaware of Henry's attempt to bring her of her shell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the soldiers start helping themselves to the o food on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fucking disappointment. When I saw those eggs, I thought it was Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have eggs again. Once everything's back to normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers pause. Exchange glances. Then burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to him! He's still waiting for Marks and Spencer's to reopen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More laughter at Bell - interrupted by the sergeant, Farr who conspicuously is not joining in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Bell's got a point. If you look at the whole life of the planet, man has only been around for a few blinks of an eye. So if the infection wipes us all out, that is a return to normality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell turns to Bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you meant, Bell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jim and Selena) Have you met our new-age sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me, Farrell, why exactly did you join the army in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I've seen in the four weeks since infection. People killing people. Which is much what I saw in the four weeks before infection, and the four weeks before that, and before that, as far back as I care to remember... People killing people. Which to my mind puts us in a state of normality right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena turns to Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry picks up on their exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must eat, Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to eat. I want to bury my dad. He's one of the people you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silence over the dinner table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broken by the thud of a mine detonation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly all the soldiers are kicking back their chai jumping to their feet. Producing SA-80s that they had und the table. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell, Jones, Mitchell, Bedford, Smith and Clifton race of the house, fanning, dropping into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, go, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more soldiers, Davis and Bell, fire from window posit on the mansion's first floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones! Cover right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three o'clock! Three o'clock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming across the grounds are four Infected, sprinting ac the lawn towards the house. Immediately, one of them is catapulted into the air by an explosion under its feet - mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers open fire, Jones closing his eyes as he pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three remaining Infected are cut down - one hit in th head by Smith, another folding under a burst from Farrell the last falling under fire from Mitchell, landing face d on a mine which explodes onto its chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chunks of Infected spin into the air, then patter down li light rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was mad! Did you see that! That was fucking mad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me, I never saw that before. Keeled over and - bam! Gone, like fucking magic. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drew a lovely bead. One shot. Right between its eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stands, looking out of the open French windows at the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena is standing behind him. She is holding her machete

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers bounce in. Mitchell and Smith in particular hyped from their adrenaline rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was all hanging in the air, and all these bits coming down, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell catches sight of Selena holding her machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads towards her, and takes the machete from her hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what: you don't need this penknife any more, sweetie. I'm here to protect you now. (winks at the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But listen, if you want to hold a huge chopper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedford bursts out laughing, and Selena grabs her machete back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Feisty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a slap on the backside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. How about right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now doubly hyped. Mitchell reaches forward and pulls up t hem of Selena's T-shirt. She yelps and twists, knocking b his hand. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! A little rough stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Farrell clearly has little command over Mitchell, who tries again for Selena's T-shirt, still laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim snaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mitchell turns immediately on Jim, his sexual charge flipping seamlessly back to violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Jim, propelling him back across the room, up against a wall) Easy, tiger. You don't want to go picking a fight with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Farrell is behind Mitchell. We see a movement (a kidney punch), and Mitchell drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping, on the ground) Ahh, you cunt. Cunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then - as if through sixth sense, sensing a presence, all turn. Henry is standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. Then Henry turns to Mitchell - who has picked himself up, and is clutching his side, breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal, first point of order after an attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Re-secure the perimeter, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get to it. Jones, Bedford, go with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear the bodies off the lawn. The rest of you go with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers exit, leaving only Jim, Henry and Selena in room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena is shaken, and won't meet Jim's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry hands Selena her machete back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My apologies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena takes the machete and exits, but Jim doesn't follo Obviously there is something he wants to say to Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Henry enter the study room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry walks over to a drinks cabinet, and pours two brand waiting for Jim to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. We're grateful. Very grateful for your protection, and just to have found other people. But if we're going to stay here with you, you're going to have to stop your men from -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who have you killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't killed anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry hands Jim his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since it began, who have you killed? You wouldn't be alive now if you hadn't killed somebody. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy. I killed a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you had to. Otherwise he'd have killed you. Survival. I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised them women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight days ago I found Jones with his gun in this mouth. He said he was going to kill himself because there was no future. What could I say to him? We kill all the infected or wait until they starve to death. And then what? What do nine men do except wait to die themselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I moved us from the blockade, I set the radio broadcasting, and I promised them women. Because women mean children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim turns and runs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And children mean a future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim bursts into the girls' bedroom. Selena is dressed, sitting next to Hannah, who is awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up. Get up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hauling them up) We're leaving. Now! NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and the girls run down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...heading for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But behind it is Mitchell, waiting, holding his SA-80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is hit full in the face, and blacks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he comes around, he can hear the sound of shouting and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell is backing away from other soldiers, who are clos in on him, even though his gun is raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this! You can't do this! Get back! I'll fucking slot you! I'll slot you, I fucking swear it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he doesn't follow his threat through. We hear him scr as the soldiers overpower him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks up, and sees Henry is kneeling over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to give you a chance. You can be with us, or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stares back at him. And Henry gazes at Jim, searching behind Jim's eyes. And understands what he finds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jim. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry gives Jim's cheek a soft pat, then rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him too. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's eyes flick to the side, where he sees Selena holdin Hannah tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena looks down at Jim, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, blindfolded, is sitting beside a radiator, to which hands are tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is in a cellar. Farrell is on the other side of the sm room, also tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, blind, looks around at the sound of Farrell's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they're doing, a few hundred miles from here? Across the channel, across the Atlantic, they're eating dinner. They're wondering what to watch on TV tonight. They're sleeping next to their wives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's head turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're here, chained to a fucking radiator because the OC has gone insane. Starting the world again when the rest of the world hasn't even fucking stopped. Think about it! How could infection cross the oceans? How could it cross the mountains and the rivers? They stopped it. And right now TVs are playing and planes are flying in the sky and the world is continuing as fucking normal. Think. Actually think about it. What would you do with a diseased little island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They quarantined us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no infection. It's just people killing people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Quarantine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the door to the cellar bursts open, revealing Mitche and Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell and Jones are leading Jim and Farrell through a small forest at the back of the mansion garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time has passed. It has started raining. Both Jim and Far have been badly beaten. Jim's shirt is ripped. Blood runs from his nose, and from a cut on the side of his head. He seems dazed. Numbed. More by the situation than his beati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Farrell are led into a clearing. Just ahead is a high, ivy-covered brick wall - the perimeter wall of the mansion. And at the base of the wall are bodies. Stacked, tangled, swarming with flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim turns, and sees Mitchell and Jones standing behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on then, you fucking pansies. Do me first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell grins, and pulls out his bayonet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're going to stick me, Mitchell? Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that how you're going to let your sergeant go out, Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mitch. Do it with the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell ignores Jones, and starts to fix the blade to th end of his gun. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to let him stick me, are you? Like a fucking dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch, come on. Just shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bayonet fixes home with a click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll shoot him, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any last words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrell spits in Mitchell's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to enjoy this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell pulls back his bayonet, and at that moment, ther an explosion of gunfire. Jones has fired and killed Farre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Farrell drops, the enraged Mitchell turns on Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid cunt! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell knocks Jones down, putting his gun right in Jone face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn. Jim has vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the side of the clearing, in the trees, there is the sound of sudden movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men immediately set off, diving back into the foliag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat passes. Then, in the pile of bodies, one of them s up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jim. We have been looking right at him. But in the tan of bodies, and the bloodstained clothes, his camouflage w complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell and Jones move fast, scanning, pushing through t undergrowth. Mitchell is absolutely furious. And as they they startle a couple of birds, which fly up from the gro making a suspiciously familiar noise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both have the same realization at the same moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell and Jones burst back into the clearing, and they start firing into the bodies, emptying a full clip into t corpses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Jones looks up to the ivy-colored wall...following t path of the ivy upwards, to the coiled razor wire, where scrap of torn and bloody clothing hangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. We're fucked, we're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. He's outside. No gun. No vehicle. He's a dead man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim runs through the woods, away from the mansion. His ha are still tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is out of breath, frightened, jumping at every sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he trips, rolls down a short slope, and when he come rest, he is looking upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above him, there is a parting in the clouds, and through parting is blue sky. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And across the sky, bisecting the blue, is a single vapor trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pin-prick of silver plane. Followed by a sonic boom. As much in Jim's head as anywhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close-up of a closed door, with the sounds of a struggle the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, suddenly, Selena's voice: hard, desperate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this to her! She's only fourteen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Note: in the room is a large, freestanding mirror.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah and Selena are cornered by Clifton, Bedford, Bell Davis. The soldiers are hyped. Bedford pulls clothes out wardrobe, yanking out dresses, underwear - throwing them the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bell stands by the closed door - frightened, caught like rabbit in the headlights between testosterone madness and horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Clifton is laughing, animal-like, tearing at Selena's clothes, while Hannah is kicking and screaming - held by Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close-up on Selena: suddenly transfixed by Hannah the you girl's fight, the hopelessness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, Selena turns, grabs Clifton's arm, and to his amazement, yanks him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she kisses him on the lips. Simply, but unambiguousl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bell, Davis and Bedford watch in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frenzy has been broken by her extraordinary action - bizarrely, so has the balance of power. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to give me a moment with Hannah. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifton nods - he seems a little dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OC. He... he wants you to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants us to dress up nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up two of the dresses Bedford has thrown - the dresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you want us to change, you'll have to get out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, powerful) It's just fucking polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Clifton nods. Acquiesces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others) Okay. Clear out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena stands with Hannah, emptying pills from her Valium bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat them, Hannah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah takes the handful of pills and holds them in her o palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she looks to Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you killing me? 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment - maybe a single moment of tenderness, a strand hair brushed from Hannah's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm making you not care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked eyes with Selena, Hannah raises the first pill to mouth. Then the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door behind opens - revealing the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifton sees what is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena crams the pills into Hannah's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers lunge for the girls, as Hannah tries to swal the pills, and Selena whirls to fight them off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and at that moment, the sound of distant siren begin t rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's at the blockade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers run down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went over the wall! We thought he'd be dead sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Davis - you're coming with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stands in the blockade, turning the handle of a siren Rain is pouring down, mingling with the blood on his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stops, and the sound of the siren starts to fade away 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the motorway ahead, through the rain, a jeep is approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep drives fast down the motorway, and pulls up. Dav is driving and Henry stands on the back, manning the jeep mounted machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep pulls up, one hundred meters from the blockade, Henry brings the mounted machine gun to bear on the block

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's see if we can sidestep the cat-and-mouse bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry opens fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullet rip through the blockade, punching holes through t vehicles, smashing through the packing crates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry stops shooting. With a peal of thunder, the rain suddenly begins to flood down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barrel of the machine gun spits and steams as the raindrops hit the hot metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis pulls up at the outskirts of the blockade, and they out of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Davis make their way into the blockade. With a signal from Henry, the two split up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry moves through the blockade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets off a controlled burst of shots into the tents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stealthily, Davis searches around the trucks and tents... 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flash of movement - fast, like an Infected, ducking beh one of trucks: Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis wipes the rain from his eyes, and presses forwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another flash of movement, around the back of the next tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis moves around the truck...but Jim is not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis turns, and sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jim, flying towards him, holding Frank's lead pipe, li drawn back over his teeth in a rictus smile, murderous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is the vision of the Infected, in his expression, his movements, the blood, everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry turns, as if having just heard something. Perhaps a scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another noise. This time it is unambiguously an Infected howl. Henry turns again. From down the motorway, and from fields, he can now see the Infected. A large number, attracted by noise of the heavy machine gun, are approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looses off a couple of shots at the Infected, then sta to back away to the jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry runs up to the jeep. Through the rain, and the wate running down the windscreen, Henry can see a figure sitti at the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry approaches cautiously, gun raised, and finds... 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Davis sitting on the front seat, dead, his skull smash open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry whirls, expecting to find Jim behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there is no one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry shoots again, blindly, emptying his clip at anythin and everything around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reloads - hurriedly, hands slipping on the wet clip, betraying nervousness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and fires at a rain shadow that sweeps between two of tents. Then his nerve is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine! Fine, you little bastard! Fucking die out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry hauls out Davis's body, gets into the driver's seat turning the ignition...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but nothing is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry turns the key again, desperately. The motor doesn't even turn over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching under the dashboard, he pulls out a handful of wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And at the moment, an Infected slams onto the windscreen, face against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry shouts out of surprise and anger, lifting his gun, fires at point-blank range, through the glass, into the Infected's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windscreen shatters, blown outwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, where our view was obscured by rain-washed glass can see clearly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Infected, in the blockade, coming through the downpour running towards the jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry opens fire and cuts them down. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim appears above Mailer in his pit, and shoots off Maile chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones stands holding his gun at Selena and Hannah, who si the sofas, opposite each other. Also in the room are Clif standing by the French windows, and Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones seems jumpy, a sheen of sweat on his forehead, as i sensing that things have gone seriously wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flicker of lightning lights up outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? Was that a claymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I heard something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. Rain and wind lash the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go and hit the floods. Take a butcher's. Girls, keep an eye on him, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones wipes at the beads of sweat on his upper lip. And i noticeable contrast, Hannah is completely calm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those pills. I think they're having an effect. I can feel them, and... I don't feel sleepy, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her sentence trails off. Then she turns to Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do if they don't come back? 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones still says nothing, but the question is clearly hit a nerve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you be the boss if Henry is dead? Is that the way if works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena looks at Hannah quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think they are coming back. I think they've been killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah's eyes flick over Jones's shoulder, and something fleeting passes over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, a mine detonates in the mansion grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, the floodlights power up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...illuminating Mailer, just on the other side of the Fre windows, just behind Clifton, a split second before he smashes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he does smash through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifton is thrown to the ground, with Mailer on top of hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Shoot him! Shoot him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones is hopeless, panicking - fires, and misses. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah watches, spaced out. Selena shakes Hannah by the shoulders, pulling Hannah upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah! Hannah! We have to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mailer vomits blood into Clifton's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena and Hannah back out of the living room, through th house. Hannah is very doped up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, Jesus, Hannah, stay with it, stay with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relaxed, as she's yanked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I feel fine. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the front hallway, and the front door bursts open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell, with Bedford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck's going on? What's all the shouti...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell is cut off by a high scream, from down the hall, the direction of the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All turn, and see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jones, running, screaming, out of one doorway, across hallway. He has lost his weapon - and is chased by Mailer but not Clifton. Like a train passing, in half a second t are out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. Then Mitchell explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't just fucking stand there! Get after them! 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mailer chases Jones into the kitchen, but when he enters, Jones is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mailer turns, and sees Bedford in the kitchen doorway, holding his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you going to do now, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But just as Bedford lifts his gun to shoot Mailer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifton runs at him, full speed from down the corridor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Bedford is knocked sideways by the infected Clifto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is at the kitchen window, looking in as Bedford is ki by Mailer and Clifton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones covers inside a cupboard, hearing Bedford's screams

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up! Up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell pushes the girls up the stairs. At the top of th staircase, wide-eyed with fear, is Bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here and defend these stairs with your fucking life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the girls, still holding Selena's arm, a Hannah is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena sees her, heading away down towards the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah! 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell starts pulling Selena in the opposite direction Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah runs into the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freestanding mirror sits in the middle of the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also on the floor are her clothes, and she starts to look through them, looking for her jeans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which she lifts up, then digs in the pocket, and pulls out...a photo of her with Frank and her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gazes at the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, there is a noise from behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up, and sees, in the reflection of the mirror, Clifton, running down the corridor towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Clifton: we burst into the dressing room, which is n empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifton freezes, then looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the camera pulls back, to reveal Hannah, clinging on the back of the large mirror, trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment - then Clifton moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence in the kitchen. Bedford lies dead, torn to pieces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cupboard creaks slowly open, and Jones peers out. He ha been hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trembling with fear, he crawls out...moves into the kitchen...peers out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones starts running. Down the corridor outside the kitch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones runs into the front hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly stops. Dead in his tracks. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is standing right in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones looks surprised, wide eyed. His mouth opens, but no sound comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back, to see: Jones has run straight into Jim's bayo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones falls, taking the gun and bayonet with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim steps over his body, and into the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim runs through the radio room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the break between two blasts of lightning, the room go dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it is re-illuminated, Jim has gone, and Mailer and Clifton have entered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry walks into the front hall, where he finds Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones is lying flat on his back, mortally wounded, gazing Still alive - but only just. Taking his very last breaths

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry kneels beside him, and Jones's eyes turn to his officer. He blinks, tries to speak, but is too weak and c to death to form the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's hand closes around Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones blinks once more. And dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim runs down a corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries a door. Locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah! Selena!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries another door. Open. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...into a kid's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim moves a sofa to block the doorway - which, as it is moved, reveals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Bell, hiding, cowering, terrified. Foetal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any bullets! I don't have any fucking bullets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mailer and Clifton outside try to force their way through and the sofa jumps forwards an inch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Infected arm flails through the half-open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim leaves Bell, and climbs out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jim exits, the door to the room bursts open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim climbs along the outside ledge, around the corner of building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, we can hear Bell screaming as he is killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim keeps going until he reaches the slope of the mansion pitched roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, he finds a skylight window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry moves into a basement corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is the sound of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Infected howl. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then suddenly, pouring out from every door and shadow ahe come a rush of Infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry opens fire, a volley into them as he backs away fas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to a door, which he slams and bolts behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell is holding Selena in one hand, and his gun in th other, dragging her down a corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The howls of the Infected fill the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your fucking mouth! You want to get us killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell opens a door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which leads nowhere. The floor of the room through the open door is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And below, in the basement-level corridor, the space is f of the Infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up at Mitchell, and Mitchell looks down at them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vision of writhing Hell. They are a mass of faces and bodies. Some are appalling wounded. Some are half-dressed ragged clothes. Some are naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls Selena away, towards another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here! IN HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is in the basement corridor, on the other side of t door he has bolted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, there is movement - rapid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry looks to the source, and sees: Clifton, running fro the front hall towards him, clearly infected. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No alarm registers on Henry's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Clifton sprints towards him, Henry remains still. Then the last moment he closes his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifton is hit, falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim enters the skylight window, into an attic, positioned above the girls' bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the floor is a hole, and through it he can see Mitchel and Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena and Mitchell stand in the middle of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the room are Selena and Hannah's bags, Selena's machet lying by the side of the bed. She can see it, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mitchell is holding her tight. He has his gun trained the door, facing away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me and you, now. And I'm going to get you out of here, and then we're going to find some nice little fucking place, with a pretty little fucking garden, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim drops down from the attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell turns, but is knocked off balance by Selena squirming out of his grip...then Jim is on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With incredible viciousness, the power and savagery of th infected, Jim beats Mitchell to death. He smashes his hea against the wall. Then he throws Mitchell to the ground, jams his thumbs in Mitchell's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it is over, Jim looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena stands, holding her machete. She is frozen by the sight of him. The blood on his face. The matted hair. He the image of an infected. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stands and takes a step towards her. Selena remains, motionless, watching him approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, just as he is about to reach her, her arm flashes upwards, holding the machete, to cut Jim down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but she hesitates. She can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was longer than a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim moves forwards, and kisses her. Simply. Hard. Then pu back, leaving a trace of blood on her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Jim's back, the door opposite, in the corridor, silently swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought...I thought you were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim moves forwards, and they kiss. Passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Jim breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I've got to tell you - I've got to tell you. The world isn't fucked. It's going to be okay. We've got a chance, if we can get to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena interrupts him, by continuing the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jim responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As, behind him, a small figure in a red dress slip into t room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a vase smashes over the back of Jim's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reels back, and Hannah is on him, jumping on his back, hitting him with her fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah! Stop! It's okay! 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not infected!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he was biting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding the back of his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was kissing her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you stoned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are interrupted by the sounds of Infected howling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Selena and Hannah run out of the house, through the front hall, to the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah gets in the driver's seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Jim yanks open the back door, ready to pile into t back only to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Henry. Sitting on the fold-down back seat. Holding his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed all my boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry pulls the trigger - a single shot. Jim is hit in th stomach and falls backwards into Selena's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah floors the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But instead of going forward, the cab reverses. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...Hannah! Hannah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab reverses fast, then Hannah slams the brakes. The slides to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Infected slams against Henry's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, the back windscreen smashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hands of the Infected grab hold of Henry's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah watches, turned around in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry scream - and we see it's Mailer's face behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah floors the accelerator again, but this time in for gear. Henry is sucked out of the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab screeches up to Jim and Selena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selena bundles Jim in, and the cab is off in a spray of gravel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Henry is killed by Mailer, the silhouettes of the Infe appear in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab races towards the cast-iron front gates of the mansion - and we see they are locked with a chain and padlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
